oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Preventive Medicine Procedures for Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wikse, Steven E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: veterinary technician
preventive medicine procedures
professional growth
medicine procedure
biosecurity programs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Granting veterinary technicians major responsibility for cattle preventive medicine procedures in a rural veterinary clinic frees up time for the veterinarians in the practice for procedures that can only be performed by a veterinarian. This leads to professional growth for the veterinary technician as they become more proficient at preventive medicine procedures and even take on a client education role. Veterinary technicians have the skills to do most of the preventive medicine procedures used in processing calves, processing replacement heifers and in collection of samples for herd biosecurity programs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2004; 159-161
